abstract: Williams first offered $30 a share for Southern Union earlier this year, while citing a string of potential concerns, according to a letter from Southern Union’s chief operating officer.
snippet: Williams first offered $30 a share for Southern Union earlier this year, while citing a string of potential concerns, according to a letter from Southern Union’s chief operating officer.
lead_paragraph: Southern Union has not tipped its hand yet on whether it will abandon its $4.2 billion sale to Energy Transfer Equity in favor of a $4.9 billion cash proposal from the Williams Companies.

headline.main: Southern Union Says Williams Bid $30 a Share in January

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
